page.title: 19CONSERVATION IN ROXWELL
page.content: The FARMERS in the area have been greatly concerned about conservation in recent years. Areas of waste land and woods have been purposely left to nature. New areas of woodland have been planted on several of the farms including specimens of{WILLOW, PINE, {POPLARS, CHESTNUT, LIME, OAK, ASH, {LAURELS, COPPER BEECH AND MAPLE.} There are many ponds and moats where fish, wild geese and ducks, and many native and specially introduced plants can be found. There are{BADGERS}to be found within the area with plans for a { {BADGER WATCH}to be erected at Newland Hall. {WILD DEER}are also living in the area and come into gardens during winter searching for food.
